doc.description: Detects gates as used in the IROS drone races, i.e., square colored gates. It does so with snake gate detection, a computationally efficient method that works onboard of the computationally constrained Parrot Bebop 1/2 drones.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_FPS
define.description: The (maximum) frequency to run the calculations at. If zero, it will max out at the camera frame rate.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_CAMERA
define.description: The V4L2 camera device that is used for the calculations.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_N_SAMPLES
define.description: The number of samples taken in an image for snake gate detection. This number is proportional to the computatinoal effort (more = slower) and the performance (more = better).

define.name: DETECT_GATE_MIN_PIX_SIZE
define.description: The minimal size the sides of an initial (square) detection should have for further processing.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_MIN_GATE_QUALITY
define.description: Gate quality is checked by verifying the proportion of colored pixels on the gate outline. This is the minimal proportion of colored pixels in order to accept a gate candidate.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_GATE_THICKNESS
define.description: Snaking goes up and down, and then left and right from the extreme points. If the gate is thick, it is better to start a little bit before the end point. This value is how thick the gate border is as a proportion of the total size.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_Y_MIN
define.description: Minimal Y of the color filter.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_Y_MAX
define.description: Maximal Y of the color filter.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_U_MIN
define.description: Minimal U of the color filter.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_U_MAX
define.description: Maximal U of the color filter.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_V_MIN
define.description: Minimal V of the color filter.

define.name: DETECT_GATE_V_MAX
define.description: Maximal V of the color filter.
